summary: Completed comprehensive frontend testing of Admin Revenue Dashboard. All features working correctly - dashboard loads at /revenue route, all 6 tabs functional (Overview, Revenue, Profit Analysis, Forecast, Self-Funding Loop, Elite Inquiries), period selector changes data range, refresh button reloads data, all metrics and charts display correctly.
passed_tests: Admin Revenue Dashboard loads at /revenue route
Key metrics displayed: MRR ($399.98), ARR ($4.8K), Churn Rate (0.0%), Customer LTV ($12.0K)
Health indicator badges displayed: Churn (EXCELLENT), LTV (EXCELLENT), Profit (EXCELLENT), Self-Funding Loop (DIVERSIFIED)
Overview tab shows Revenue Trend chart and Revenue by Source pie chart
Revenue tab shows Total Revenue ($18.8K), Avg Monthly ($3.1K), Top Source (Ebook Sales) and trend charts
Profit Analysis tab shows Net Profit ($18.5K), Profit Margin (97.9%), Total Expenses ($395), Expense Ratio (2.0%)
Forecast tab shows predicted revenue for next 3 months with confidence levels (high/medium/low)
Self-Funding Loop tab shows Subscription vs Other Revenue breakdown ($949.94 vs $17.9K)
Elite Inquiries tab shows inquiry stats (Total: 8, Pending: 5, Contacted: 3, Converted: 0) and recent inquiries table
Period selector changes data range (3, 6, 12 months) - tested all options
Refresh button reloads all data successfully
Navigation sidebar includes Revenue menu item with correct icon
All Calculator API endpoints return correct data with authentication
seed_data_creation: Existing calculator data used for testing - includes subscription revenue, ebook sales, YouTube ads, coaching sessions, app revenue
context_for_next_testing_agent: Admin Revenue Dashboard fully tested and working. Uses Recharts library for visualizations. All data comes from Calculator service endpoints (/api/calculator/*). Dashboard accessible at /revenue route for authenticated admins. 6 tabs: Overview, Revenue, Profit Analysis, Forecast, Self-Funding Loop, Elite Inquiries. Period selector supports 3/6/12 months. All metrics update correctly when period changes.

mocked_apis.note: All data comes from real Calculator service endpoints - no mocking
